dt: {bc}a theory that physical matter is the only or fundamental reality and that all being and processes and {d_link|phenomena|phenomenon} can be explained as {d_link|manifestations|manifestation} or results of matter {dx_def}see {dxt|matter:1||2}{/dx_def}
{bc}a doctrine that the only or the highest values or objectives lie in material well-being and in the {d_link|furtherance|furtherance} of material progress
{bc}a doctrine that economic or social change is materially caused {dx}compare {dxt|historical materialism||}{/dx}
{bc}a preoccupation with or stress upon material rather than intellectual or spiritual things

dt.t: {wi}materialism{/wi}, hedonism, and the overriding quest for personal gratification

shortdef: a theory that physical matter is the only or fundamental reality and that all being and processes and phenomena can be explained as manifestations or results of matter
a doctrine that the only or the highest values or objectives lie in material well-being and in the furtherance of material progress
a doctrine that economic or social change is materially caused

dt.t: Anti-communism was a favorite subject of the 1950s, he said, but so, to his surprise, was {wi}anti-materialism{/wi}.
Anyone of a certain age will recall that dumpster diving first became a lifestyle choice in the 1960s as part of the decade's brief flirtation with {wi}antimaterialism{/wi} …

utxt.t: The absence of money values may be partly caused by the vague {wi}anti-materialistic{/wi} sentiments of the sorts of young college graduates who choose Washington over New York and Los Angeles.

dt: {bc}the Marxist theory that maintains the material basis of a reality constantly changing in a dialectical process and the priority of matter over mind {dx}compare {dxt|historical materialism||}{/dx}

shortdef: the Marxist theory that maintains the material basis of a reality constantly changing in a dialectical process and the priority of matter over mind

dt: {bc}the Marxist theory of history and society that holds that ideas and social institutions develop only as the superstructure of a material economic base {dx}compare {dxt|dialectical materialism||}{/dx}

shortdef: the Marxist theory of history and society that holds that ideas and social institutions develop only as the superstructure of a material economic base
